Package com.api.hub.logging

Class LoggingEncoder

java.lang.Object
ch.qos.logback.core.spi.ContextAwareBase
ch.qos.logback.core.encoder.EncoderBase<ch.qos.logback.classic.spi.ILoggingEvent>
com.api.hub.logging.LoggingEncoder
All Implemented Interfaces:
ch.qos.logback.core.encoder.Encoder<ch.qos.logback.classic.spi.ILoggingEvent>, ch.qos.logback.core.spi.ContextAware, ch.qos.logback.core.spi.LifeCycle
public class LoggingEncoder extends ch.qos.logback.core.encoder.EncoderBase<ch.qos.logback.classic.spi.ILoggingEvent>
Custom Logback encoder for transforming ILoggingEvent instances into enriched structured log messages within the AI-Agent Framework.

This encoder extracts relevant contextual information from log events and integrates it with metadata stored in LoggingDataHolder. It ensures that each log message includes agent-specific details such as class name, log level, log marker, and formatted message, which is crucial for centralized logging, monitoring, and troubleshooting in agent-based distributed systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Fetch agent logging metadata via LoggingDataHolder.
  • Extract and include structured information such as log level, class name, and markers.
  • Produce log entries in a consistent, byte-encoded format.

Typical Usage:

  • Configured as the encoder in a Logback appender (e.g., FileAppender, ConsoleAppender).
  • Used to enhance observability of individual agents in multi-agent workflows.

Example Log Output (as String):

 [INFO] | AgentClass: com.agent.ChatBotAgent | Marker: WORKFLOW | Message: Agent initialized successfully
Since:
1.0

    • headerBytes

      public byte[] headerBytes()
      Returns the byte representation of the log header.

      This implementation currently returns null as no header is required.

      Returns:
      header bytes or null
